_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four kinds of deeds [an4.233:5.4]: Dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results
Neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds
The characteristics of each kind of deed: Dark deeds with dark results - hurtful choices by way of body, speech, and mind, rebirth in a hurtful world, hurtful contacts, hurtful feelings
Bright deeds with bright results - pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind, rebirth in a pleasing world, pleasing contacts, pleasing feelings

Dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results - both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind, rebirth in a world that is both hurtful and pleasing, hurtful and pleasing contacts, both hurtful and pleasing feelings

Neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds - the intention to give up dark deeds with dark results, bright deeds with bright results, and both dark and bright deeds with both dark and bright results.
